remarks: If for every element of a finite indexing set ` A ` there exists a corresponding element of another set ` B ` , then there exists a finite subset of ` B ` consisting only of those elements which are indexed by ` A ` .  Proven without the Axiom of Choice, unlike ~ indexdom . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 12-Sep-2015.)
statement:
indexfi $p |- ( ( A e. Fin /\ B e. M /\ A. x e. A E. y e. B ph ) -> E. c e. Fin ( c C_ B /\ A. x e. A E. y e. c ph /\ A. y e. c E. x e. A ph ) ) $.
$d A c x y $.
$d B c x y $.
$d c ph $.
